title: Centrist Senate Democrats Signal Opposition to Biden Banking Nominee
sub_head: Concern conveyed in telephone call with committee chairman, likely scuttling Saule Omarova’s chances of confirmation
body:
WASHINGTON—A group of Senate Democrats have privately voiced their opposition to President Biden’s nomination of Saule Omarova to become a top banking regulator, likely scuttling the academic’s chances of confirmation.
Montana Sen. Jon Tester, Arizona Sen. Kyrsten Sinema and Virginia Sen. Mark Warner—all centrist Democrats—conveyed their opposition to Senate Banking Committee Chairman Sherrod Brown (D., Ohio) on a Wednesday telephone call, according to a person familiar with the discussion.
